summary: A complete collection of the entire \"The Real Barenziah\" series, with the censored passage re-added.
descriptionHtml:
What use is an M rating for your game if you\'re not going to use it, Bethesda?  Not being a huge fan of unnecessary censorship, what I\'ve done here is collected the entire series of \"The Real Barenziah\" into [s]one[/s] two books, and re-added the passage from Daggerfall that had been taken out in every game since then.  

To clarify, this book uses the extended text from the five-volume set in Morrowind, Oblivion, and Skyrim, but replaces the text \"[This passage has been censored by order of the Temple.]\" with the original scene present in Daggerfall.  Nothing else is changed.

You can find the new books, \"The Complete Barenziah, volumes 1 and 2\" in the following locations:

Riverwood, Sleeping Giant Inn
Dawnstar, Windpeak Inn
Dragon Bridge, Four Shields Tavern
Falkreath, Dead Man\'s Drink
Ivarstead, Vilemyr Inn
Kynesgrove, Braidwood Inn
Markarth, Silverblood Inn
Morthal, Moorside Inn
Riften, Haelga\'s Bunkhouse
Rorikstead, Frostfruit Inn
Solitude, Winking Skeever
Whiterun, Drunken Huntsman
Windhelm, Candlehearth Hall
Winterhold College, Arcanaeum
Winterhold, The Frozen Hearth

The books will always be someplace close to the bar, most often on top of a cabinet behind or to the side.

----------------------------------------------------------
---UPDATES---

- v1.2  Splits the book into 2 volumes, fixing the issue with text cutting off near the end of one passage.  

- v1.1  Recently tweaked to add the book to every other inn I could think of.
----------------------------------------------------------

Because of the raunchy nature of the text, and the fact that it was actually removed from the last 3 games, this file will be marked as adult.

Please feel free to include this book as part of any compilation or collection of other books, or really anything else.  All I ask for is a little nod in my direction for putting it together to begin with.
author: Rekkin
